website_summaries.verdict: If no-frills storage is what you need, this workhorse of a trunk has it all: large capacity, stackability, durability, wheels, and a comfortable price point.
pros: Weather and impact resistant as well as airtight, making it perfect for transporting via truck
Strong construction, yet still lightweight enough to carry or wheel from place to place
Hunters and campers like it for storing various gear and tools
cons: The lid comes completely off, and some consumers would prefer one side have hinges
Needs 4 separate locks to keep it completely secure

customer_reviews.title: Good but need dimensions listed on product page.
customer_reviews.text: Plano always makes super good anything. My dad still uses tool and tackle boxes that he's had since before I was born in the 80s. However, Plano or Amazon or someone needs to come to these pages and list the actual dimensions. I went by other customer comments and reviews and ended up with a box four inches longer than I was expecting--just over 24" total when you factor in the handles/strap things. Now I can only fit two in my closet instead of four.
customer_reviews.author: Mabs

customer_reviews.title: Great for overhead cargo rack
customer_reviews.text: This will work excellent for my overhead cargo rack on my SUV. It’s strong enough to hold moderately heavy items while still being inherently lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Beeton

customer_reviews.title: great sturdy and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: i bought two of these for camping. it is not listed as waterproof but i have tested it to the limits and it did well. i strapped two to my roof loaded down with gear driving through torrential rain storms and all the gear stayed dry. i have one for food and one for camping equipment. even with ratchet straps cranked down on them hard they held up. there is also a way to lock up if you have to.. it wont keep a thief out but it will deter them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Locke

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's not a penguin case but amazing value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: DigitalJ

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We have many varieties of plastic storage bins accumulated over the years. I wanted one that was water tight (not water proof - but secure enough to keep out rain), had a locking mechanism and was large enough to hold all of my camping gear so I could just throw one large bin in the bed of my truck. This does the job. I can get sleeping bag, tent and all of my cooking and survival accessories in here. This was really the best value for the money I could find. And the bin itself is not heavy, so it is easy to lift and carry. Ordering some smaller bins for garage storage.
customer_reviews.author: John Phebus

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage Boxes
customer_reviews.text: The perfect boxes for my camping gear, which I store on my roof rack. It keeps the dust, mud and water out. Even though they are not waterproof, I have never had any water enter when driving in the rain with them on my roof. Plenty of room to store equipment and very durable product!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: These are totes the best totes ever!
customer_reviews.text: As amazing as a tote can be! We used these to transport our camping equipment to the Canadian Rockies from the US as checked luggage. We zip-tied them shut and the contents were not disturbed at all. Strong plastic with a lip that helps to reinforce the sides so that they stack securely and are strong enough to sit on. If you're in the market for a great tote, buy this. If you're in the market for a new pair of shoes, buy this instead.
customer_reviews.author: John Vanderburg

customer_reviews.title: I'm not worried about waterproofing but all you need to do is put some weather seal gasket around the lid and it'll seal up just
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about Plano cases. I keep two in my patrol car filled with all the gear I need to take care of just about any emergency situation and one in my Jeep with recovery gear. I'm not worried about waterproofing but all you need to do is put some weather seal gasket around the lid and it'll seal up just fine. They are sturdy and and have some handy tabs for strapping them down. The best part is the price. Can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: SteelyBuns

customer_reviews.title: With one small addition
customer_reviews.text: Great totes that I use for a variety of purposes both indoors and out. I did have an occasional problem with bugs getting in but solved it by using foam weatherstrip (3/8-Inch x 3/16-Inch, B0025KUSX) in the lid groove. With a little care you can match the strip up and not leave a gap. With the weatherstrip installed you just have to use slightly more pressure on the latch.
customer_reviews.author: JeffW

customer_reviews.title: Storage worthy but not rugged
customer_reviews.text: It holds items well enough for mild use or as storage. As for durability, we have used this as a roof rack item when camping for several months now. One security hole supposedly intended for zip ties has broken clean off. One if the latches perpetually pops off too. Not rugged but it's good enough for static storage. Update: The plastic around the latches isn't durable. I've had to buy a different product to use when traveling. If you want a rugged bin, don't buy this one.:(
customer_reviews.author: Amazed

customer_reviews.title: Nifty large plastic case
customer_reviews.text: Bought to store ammo for a cross-country drive, but once fully loaded it weighs too much. But, that's okay. I simply changed my plan and loaded other valuables into here. When I went to put a normal master lock on it, the lock holes were just a tad too small. I took a drill bit and made them about 1/16" larger so the locks would fit. Other than the lock issue, I have no problems with this and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat C.

customer_reviews.title: This worked excellent as a UTV storage box
customer_reviews.text: This worked excellent as a UTV storage box. I have a RZR 900, 2017. I just bungeed and netted it down. Last weekend was its first test and the terrain was really rough and the water very deep. Everything in the box stayed nice and dry. Great Box.
customer_reviews.author: P. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: I'm 252# on the doc's scale and I stood on the lid with out anything in the trunk and was pleased that it not only held my wt
customer_reviews.text: Bought one, and ordered another right away. Read the back and for about holding 250# on the lid so... I'm 252# on the doc's scale and I stood on the lid with out anything in the trunk and was pleased that it not only held my wt. it could have held more!! Fits my Cabela's 6 man Alaskan geo dome with ground cloth and fly, ect., axe, hatchet, and a couple of more smaller camping items. Plan to use the other for travel.
customer_reviews.author: rb

customer_reviews.title: Good balance between sturdiness, durability and weight when paying USPS to ship Priority mail.
customer_reviews.text: Cases travelled well through to Kabul, Afghanistan where I reside. Good balance between sturdiness, durability and weight when paying USPS to ship priority mail. Cases leverage "anchoring" created by padlocks or zip-ties securing each corner for structural integrity. Otherwise, case may prop open and release contents per anecdotal accounts by others here.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Brito

customer_reviews.title: Brand is great, this item, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected more. Feels cheap and flexes pretty easy. I was surprised this was such a cheap product, I’ve purchase Plano rifle cases that are amazing quality. This, not so much. The cheap no name brand are the same as these, I wouldn’t recommend this particular item if you’re looking for a quality case. I would recommend the brand if you’re looking for weapon cases.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Built Storage
customer_reviews.text: These are well-made storage totes. These are not like the cheap plastic totes you buy in WallyWorld/Target/etc. They ARE NOT waterproof air-tight sealed units, but the lid does slip down over the tote's edges to keep out normal rainfall. They latch well and are lockable with a padlock. The handles are heavy duty and built into the unit. If you can pick it up, the tote will handle the weight. The other nice feature is these units interlock with one another when stacked. The lids are sturdy like the rest of the unit and will not collapse when stacked. You should be able to easily stack 3 heavily filled units without fear of collapse
customer_reviews.author: LookN4ABargain

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is high quality, but check brick-and-mortars for better prices.
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about the product itself. They're a nice quality and weatherproof. They work great for anything you wanna throw in a box. They held up great for 300 miles on a roof rack while doing some overlanding thru both dust and monsoon rain. Zero issues. My only negative experience was walking in to a shop and seeing them for $7 cheaper a piece. I can understand that -- because I'm sure they're not cheap to ship, and I feel they're more than worth what I paid. Just keep your eyes open and you may find them a bit cheaper in person is all.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: Went camping in Alabama at Cheaha State Park - traveled in an open jeep for 7 hours. Needed some watertight camping boxes. We were rained on several times - during the drive and during the stay at the tent. Nothing got wet - they packed super easy, the boxes fit well with room left over in the back of the jeep. I ordered the first two and loved them so much that we ordered two more for clothing and incidentals. There are four boxes in the back of the jeep. Three of the boxes stayed outside for a week on the ground, no ants, no water no anything! Great box!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Dupre

customer_reviews.title: Great container!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an inexpensive solution for a dry storage box on my atv. It was easy to strap on to the rear rack. It has held up very well and has kept my gear dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McKenna

customer_reviews.title: No Lid, got container NO TOP!!
customer_reviews.text: No Lid, got container NO TOP!! ORDERED TWO 56 QT. TUB. GOT ONE ON SATURDAY MARCH 23, OK. GOT CONTAINER AND LID. GOT THE OTHER 56QT. TOTE SUNDAY MARCH 24, NO LID!! NO COVER FOR TOTE. JUST BROWN PAPER. GOT 3 LARGER 68QT. CONTAINER TOTES ON WEDNESDAY, MARCH 26. 3 TOTES W/ LIDS.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Air-Tight Storage Container
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good locking top storage container that could ride on the back of a truck in the rain and the contents wouldn't get wet. This was perfect for my semi-annual camping/fishing trips to the lake, because it was on the back of the truck in a thunderstorm on the way to the last camp. And nothing inside got wet, and the outside quickly dried once the sun peeked out. It's waterproof as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: RastaGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Don't worry about the "ribs".
customer_reviews.text: Somebody complained about "ribs" reducing the usable storage space on these. Not accurate. Inside is completely clear of obstructions except for the structural moldings which steal maybe a quarter inch at most. Not an issue. Great product. The 56-quart version seems roomier than the 68-quart due to the proportions. I've bought and use them all.
customer_reviews.author: PeaceWhenever

customer_reviews.title: You're not getting what you think you will be getting
customer_reviews.text: I spent the money that I did on this because I thought we built a little tougher it's actually very flexible a little too flexible because then when you put in certain things and then try to put the lid on and lock it up it doesn't lock up but it don't fit right it becomes a hassle it's a little too wobbly needs to be a little thicker gauge don't waste your money look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Good Storage Container
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this container to keep our varmint/predator hunting gear in one place. The other plastic box I had been using left our stuff with a strong plastic smell. Can't have that when predator hunting. This one does have a slight odor in it, but it does not stick to our gear so I am putting up with it. Overall I am quite happy with this purchase as there is plenty of room for the gear we need to store in it. I would have given it 5 stars if there had not been the slight odor. Maybe with time that odor will dissipate.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price, Surprisingly strong :)
customer_reviews.text: Got this to put my Ridgid K45 sewer tool and accessories, original Metal box that houses the tools got destroyed by accident and was over 80 bucks plus shipping to replace and this was 1/3 of its price plus free shipping with Prime. This is Big and strong enough to place and hold everything in it and I don't have to worried about the box getting rusted like the original. I only wish it has a handle on this box (for my particular need) which I end up installing it to make it easier to carry the box around and it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: ac13

customer_reviews.title: Great trunk for SHTF or storage.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic gear trunk for in-house storage or short outdoor storage. This is NOT air-tight. S’long as it’s not submerged this is water-resistant. As for it’s durability, it’s a molded plastic. It’ll last a lifetime. It’ll a 14.5” without issue. A PC on top in full load out and all other odds and ends of kit. You probably could fit a bump helmet but I don’t have one so can’t confirm. The locks are effective but flimsy. They wouldn’t hold up against heavy abuse and remained closed. You could zip-tie the lock holds with 80-100lb ties and probably be fine but for me that defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Shane M.

customer_reviews.title: Mojo Duck Case
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a hard case to hold my two baby Mojo spinning wing decoys, but couldn't find anything on the market. Decided to buy this case and fill it with rigid foam I cut to fit both decoys. Works perfectly, super easy to carry around, and haven't gotten a drop of water into the case when it's on the bottom of the boat. Also, works great as a seat on the boat, sturdy enough for me to sit on all day without bending or cracking the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is this available in the heavy duty version ? Same size?
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact it fits perfectly in my SUV, the price is high for the build quality. For a buck and some change, you guys offered the heavy duty version. However you don’t have it in this size or do you? Wanted something study that I can sit on while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Bing M. Yee

customer_reviews.title: very good for money
customer_reviews.text: good size, fits in back seat easily, seen much worse for twice money, gonna use this for emergency evacuation (will stock it this evening, i.e. hurricane season), don't know how water tight, but suspect it doesn't seal well, but for what I need, will be just fine. Very light weight but appears to be sturdy enough for my need. No internal stiffeners, but not necessary. Gonna buy another tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size to store my trailer accessories
customer_reviews.text: I have a tandem wheel trailer that I use for hauling water and other utility. It has a 9,000 lb. winch for pulling heavy items into the trailer. I like to keep my winch cable, winch controller, hydraulic jack, tie-downs, and cargo net in the trailer so I don't forget them. This Plano Storage Trunk (68 Quart) is the ideal size to store all of my accessories. It is lockable and after a lot of abuse on bumpy dirt roads with a few heavy items inside, it is holding up well. Overall, I'm pleased with the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Tote!
customer_reviews.text: This is a seriously awesome tote, it's sturdy, easily lockable/unlockable, and easy to transport. It also has "tie down" notches on the handle for securing it on road trips to keep it from knocking around in your vehicle. Add a little thin weather stripping around the inside border of the lid and you got yourself an absolutely perfect tote for long term storage as well (climate controlled if you're using it to store valuables). 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: John Hiebs

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for secure storage and doesn't fit normal padlocks
customer_reviews.text: Won't fit a regular Master Lock (178D) combo lock. Instead of having a place to put a normal lock, this unit requires four padlocks to secure the chamber, which means you'll spend more on locks than the cost of the container, and the container doesn't even fit the locks needed to secure the unit. Generally worthless as a secure storage unit.
customer_reviews.author: Prescott Paulin

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend if you are using these Outdoors they're not watertight
customer_reviews.text: These are as advertised as waterproof or water tight which they are not even close would not recommend for anything that will be out in the weather they condensate and ruin everything inside
customer_reviews.author: Chris Goflin

customer_reviews.title: Nice large tote, great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This item was just what I expected. I regularly have to stay somewhere that it is necessary to lock up my belongings when I'm away, and this does the trick perfectly. Just two things I wish I had know before purchasing... 1. If you are planning to lock it, you need TWO locks because the tote opens on both sides. 2. You need a padlock with a thin hasp. I find the locks with cable hasps work best. The hole for the hasp is very small, and the lock I ordered when I got the tote was too large. Beyond that, it's a quality product at a great price! Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Keltner

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising: Lockable?? - Yea if your locking something from an infant -
customer_reviews.text: Even with 4 locks, this thing doesn't secure crap, a child could reach in, bend the box and pull the contents out
customer_reviews.author: Second Options

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price point of competition
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price point of competition. Only downfall is that if using ratchet straps to tie them down, the lid will deform and dent. This is not an issue with higher priced boxes. If you want something that will look good use after use, this is not the item. My lid has dents after 2 uses strapping it to my roof rack just tight enough not to move. Cannot attest to water tightness, I have yet to use it in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great and sturdy bins
customer_reviews.text: These bins are awesome! I bought them to pack, keep in the garage, and be ready to throw in the trunk of the car at a moment's notice. Forbins fit easily in the back of my SUV, and hold a good amount of stuff even though they're not overly huge and cumbersome. Plano always makes great storage units for all kinds of things, and these bins are no different. The price on Amazon is wonderful for this product, and I highly recommend them for things that are going to be thrown around and don't have to be treated delicately. I just feel bad for our mail person having to deliver such a huge box! :D
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Handy Trunk
customer_reviews.text: I am a volunteer fire chief and respond to calls in my personal vehicle. I use this product to hold my turnout gear in the back of my truck to keep it dry and out of the cab of my pickup. Dirty gear has carcinogens that I don't want inside. It keeps my gear clean and dry. I actually have two of these, one in each of my two vehicles. I have recommended them to two other firefighters that like them as well. The latches can be a little bit of a pain to get them close completely because the sidewalls flex, but its a minor inconvenience. I think I may purchase more for hunting gear and things like that.
customer_reviews.author: sstumpe

customer_reviews.title: Beats spending $250 for a utv specific cargo box!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat it for the money! Provides plenty of storage. Mounted it to my P500 using some aluminum bracing and some stainless bolts. I only wish that they had a version without the wheels as I don’t need them. Also it would be nice if one side was hinged, but this sure beats the hell out of spending a couple hundred dollars for something made specifically for a utv.
customer_reviews.author: allegheny american

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars is being generous On the Fence
customer_reviews.text: I have this container at home already. I copied all the info off that one and searched for it on amazon. This one generated at the top of the list. I compared it with other and read reviews. It is most certainly not what I have at home. It is thin and flimsy. The top removes all the way. It is hard to get back on. I needed it to move a kid to the dorms. I would not tie this down on the roof rack. If it fell off it would shatter. Looking for a replacement. If I wanted to store seasonal clothing in my basement this would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: pkpk

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it. It’s good.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is good. The wheels at one side of the trunk is particularly useful. Easily lifted and pulled even if it’s almost fully loaded. The locks close with good tactile click. I stacked to a height of 4 with no issues. The trucks also self align well. Obviously, one has to exercise common sense to put the heaviest trunk at the bottom and lightest on top. All in all, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It’s an overall good box for the price
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice box. I leave it outside to store some home gym stuff. Like the side with wheels for me to pull it to where I was want it when cleaning my patio. The lid is not as convenient. You really have to lined it well or one side would pop out of alignment when you try to put the other side together. .. I mean it’s not a huge deal.. but It can get a little annoying
customer_reviews.author: X. Fan

customer_reviews.title: So far these work great for my camping and shooting gear.
customer_reviews.text: Decent boxes for easy storage and organization and transport. They don't appear they'd hold up to a lot of abuse, but loaded with some pretty heavy stuff (clay pigeons and shotgun shells) I experienced no problems at all with the first outing. I would not use these for food atorage, as they do have a plastic smell out of the box. I left mine open and outside for a couple days, and most of that subsided, but there's still a slight odor. For gear like tents, stoves, fuel, lanterns and misc camp stuff this worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Foster

customer_reviews.title: Not the most durable but pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing used it once and it had a crack along one wheel. The seller was pretty great about it and sent a replacement right away. Pretty happy with it overall. Just don't assume it's bulletproof. Pack it lighter than you think it can hold and be relatively easy on it and it should last. Love it otherwise. Great locks and nice wheels for flat surfaces. It also has a large top area that stacks nicely and works well as a tabletop.
customer_reviews.author: Orange

customer_reviews.title: Item appearance and usability is good except for aftermarket support
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this a low rating for the lack of aftermarket support from the manufacturer. One of the "ears" where you can insert a padlock was broken on my unit. I tried to reach them twice although the manufacturer is in the same state that I lived thinking I might get a quicker response. NO RESPONSE of any kind was received. I even offered to buy a new one to replace the broken part on the trunk. IN terms of design and maneuvarability, the box is acceptable. The overall durability is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe V

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: There are supports on the inside of the lid. They fit into each other securely. I only have 3, but I have been able to stack them 3 high full of stuff and not worry about breaking the bottom one or them sliding off of each other. They have protrusions that fit into each other. There are 4 small holes where you could put locks, but it almost seems like you would need all 4 locked to make it difficult for anyone to get in. Also the holes are pretty small so you would need fairly small locks. I'm just keeping them in my house though so I'm not too worried about break ins. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: After shopping around I went with this option. Needed something to hold all our gear for our band. Musician’s trunks are hundreds of dollars and this is affordable. It’s ok plastic and seems to hold a lot. We were able to put mic stands in it our PAs and the like. Worked so well I got another for the rest of our stuff. Just make sure to put the heavier items on the end with the rollers so nothing gets crushed or destroyed by the weight when rolling it around. Great product for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Oscentatious

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Functional for Car Trunk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my compact car's trunk and it fits well inside. I store all my needed car accessories (water, flashlight, wrenches, etc.) and car emergency items (flares) inside it. The lid and bin are made of solid tough plastic that won't crack compared to other Snap-Tite clear boxes that you find at the Discount Stores. It also doesn't slide around in the trunk compared to a cardboard or plastic box. It is easy to wipe and seals the contents inside well from outside spills. It frees up my trunk space as all the contents are stored to one side. It did come in a very large box so beware when carrying it off your stairs or doorstep.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Truck bed approved
customer_reviews.text: This is almost exactly what I needed. The only thing I don’t like is that the lid doesn’t have a hinge. The lid comes all the way off. The only reason I don’t like that was how to have to secure it when you want to lock it. That’s my fault though, I didn’t realize that when I bought it. That said, I have kept it. I have a truck bed cover so it wasn’t a big deal and I use it constantly! It’s worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K Owens

customer_reviews.title: Good box
customer_reviews.text: This is no pelican case, but for the money it does what I need it to do. Don't expect it to be super rigid at this price point. I have a couple of their rifle cases that are great and rigid , but they cost a lot more. I would recommend these boxes, as long as you understand what you get at this price level. I have about 50 lbs. of network gear in it. rolls well. I wish it had a better handle to pull with, but the integrated handle does work, just a bit akward.
customer_reviews.author: Real Customer (not a fake reviewer)

customer_reviews.title: Best quality storage box
customer_reviews.text: I have a Plano case for my AR15s, so decided to try these Plano storage boxes. This box is fantastic, same type quality as my AR15/Rifle box. These are probably the best storage box/container you can find for the price. The latches are great, has lock hole to add a padlock and the box is thick, so it doesn't flex. I bought the smaller one(this one) and larger one. Was trying to get a idea of size and this is perfect for back of a suv, to store tools or even ammo and misc things. Might use this as my tool box, it's nice looking and top quality.
customer_reviews.author: rotwiler

customer_reviews.title: Great bin for outdoor gear
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for organizing items in rear cargo area for overland trips. The nearly vertical walls and slightly raised lid make this perfect for maximizing internal storage. I have been able to stand and sit on these with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver Jr.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love it I have two of them for my truck. 2019 tacoma 5foot bed, sits nicely. I have my camping stuff in one an my truck stuff in the other
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: The holes for the locks is on the smaller side...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to hold my powerblocks and other weights in our backyard. I wanted something to keep them away from the elements and add a little security. I know one can simple break the case to get in, but it's extremely heavy and I don't move it, so it works for me. My one gripe was the holes for the locks were on the smaller side and probably wouldn't take anything larger than a simple school/gym locker style lock. I actually had to make the holes a little bigger just to fit these master locks ( ). Other than that slight modification, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Jasshole

customer_reviews.title: Back in the box
customer_reviews.text: It’s kinda hard to review a plastic box, but I’ll try. The size is exactly what I was looking for. I have a 2014 Silverado double cab. I wanted a box that I can put on the back seat behind the driver seat. Just a place to put a few things that won’t fit underneath the seat itself. Small compressor, some emergency supplies and a few larger tools. This works great. It’s sturdy, stackable and lockable. Not that a lock is gonna slow anyone down very much. But better than nothing. It’s doing what I got it for. No complaints except the price. But I’d buy again. Made in the USA 🇺🇸. Good on you Plano. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: MooseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor/indoor storage
customer_reviews.text: Great for pet food, Bird seeds. I keep it outdoors. The squirrels and raccoons do not get into it! It stays dry!
customer_reviews.author: Jlambert485

customer_reviews.title: Took this camping and was very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room to pack lots of stuff. And the lid is raised instead of flat, so you can pack the box just past the top if you need to, because there is still a little room inside the lid! The lid locks down and is easy to lock/unlock. This can also be used to sit on. It was raining when we went camping and it didn't leak, however it was partially under cover. I don't see how it would leak though, the lid latches down well. Such a great value and did well camping that I bought another one when I got home so now I have a "camp kitchen" tote and a "misc camping crap" tote. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant! 150% water tight. Thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is WAY too good for the price! I bought this to keep outside on my uncovered deck, to hold grill accessories. It is the exact right size to hold bbq tools, grilling veggie baskets, a lighter, grilling mits, skewers, and some newspapers to start my charcoal grill. After 2 weeks of miserable weather, high winds, pouring rain, drastic rapid temperature changes... Even the newspaper was bone dry when I opened it. Thrilled! I plan to buy another but larger, to keep outside, for pool towels!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth G.

customer_reviews.title: Unbelieveably Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a container to hold the gear my church uses at our nursing home ministry, and this was the right size and a much better price than others I looked at. It really proved its worth recently when someone at the nursing home set a couple of heavy speakers on top of it, causing it to bend in the middle. Was I ever upset--until I discovered that it returned perfectly to its original shape again. I hope we never need to replace it, but if we do I know I'll want this same tub again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to use on my rack and they worked out great for a 2 month trip. We experienced rain, and even August snow storm on Montana and these Plano's kept all of our gear dry and dust free. I'm really impressed with them especially for the price. There was one small issue that I have and it's with the flex in the sidewalls when ratcheted down. They held up fine but it was a bit concerning when I first saw it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Still overpowering chemical smell after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: These storage bins are not as substantial as I had expected, in terms of thickness. That means they are lighter, which is good, especially for travel. They stack well, and seem sturdy enough. But maybe I needed to wash them out several times, because they still smell strongly like chemicals even after leaving the lids off for one month, and anything I put in them smells like that. Do not put any food items in these for storage longer than a day. Otherwise, they look like they would perform well.
customer_reviews.author: PV Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: TOXIC SMELL
customer_reviews.text: This product needs to be investigated by the FDA. Has a strong Toxic smell. These chemical vapors fill the home in contact with food, pets, babies.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Warren

customer_reviews.title: RZR
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice box. I use it in back of my RZR to keep tools and straps. Works great
customer_reviews.author: booyaa666

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for organizing an SUV
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this box. I bought it to replace my "junk box" I keep in the back of my SUV. I like this one because its black color make it invisible to anyone peering through my tinted windows. I also really like the way the lid locks on tight. I withheld one star because they are not water tight. Contents will stay dry if the lid is on and the box remains upright. It will not keep items dry if submerged. Love this box though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these. Both arrived in great condition with no damage. Both were delivered on different days from UPS. Some people have whined about the smell and they do have an odor when received, but leave the top off for a day and the odor is gone. People have also whined about the size-pay attention to the specs and don't leave a bad review because you can't read. Great item for under $16.00 each I purchased them for.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great storage trunks.
customer_reviews.text: These storage totes are great for stuff that you don’t want to get wet or have insects get in. I have some bulk dry goods in two of these in my shed and nothing has gotten in to bother them. yes, they’re are cheaper plastic storage boxes out there, but this one is actually going to protect what you put in it, it’s not going to collapse when you put another one on top of that, and it’s not going to break or crack after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: BlueBellBlue

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This trunk is great and no issues with checking this as luggage at the airline. Four zip ties lock it down really well. The wheels on one end really help in moving it around when it's filled up and heavy (empty it is very light). Friends who came over and saw it now want to buy one. It's on my terrace level which is exposed to rain and Sun (which destroyed my previous trunk) and weathers all the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Raccoon Proof
customer_reviews.text: Well built - very value priced. Sturdy and strong locking handles. Bought it for overnight storage of my flat bird feeders and suet containers which raccoons steal at night. The raccoons had become adept as sneaking into my Rubbermaid container that just snapped shut - even with 50 lbs of bucket on top. The raccoons have tried but cannot get into this container. Well pleased - especially for the lower pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A good, standard-sized equipment box
customer_reviews.text: We are using these boxes to hold camping supplies in an SUV. They replace cardboard boxes, which are cheap and common, but which sometimes rupture and which can be odd in their sizes. These boxes are quite strong, they stack well, they have a consistent size, and this size is just right for a full, single-person carry.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for summer camp!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter to use at a camp this summer. It has plenty of room for a week's worth of clothing and toiletries, and secures nicely with built-in eyelets for small padlocks. The side handles and wheels are a great plus, and held up well for her, although to date it's only been used once. I'm likely going to "borrow" it for storage in the bed of my truck until it's needed again... It's definitely NOT what I'd consider to be "heavy-duty", but for me, it served its intended purpose perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk W.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We use these to store our stuff for camping. 4 across fit on our hitch trailer exactly. They stack with indentations on the top. We went through a rainstorm and everything stayed dry. They can be locked or tied down. We also got the larger sportsman box with wheels. That is also very nice but I wish they had made the top so the smaller boxes could fit in the indentations on the top. I would love it if they would make a sportsman box that was exactly twice as big so two of these could stack on the larger box.
customer_reviews.author: ncp1113

customer_reviews.title: Meh...ok for storage.  Not great to move around a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Not very heavy duty. I have some ziploc storage totes that are better. No weatherproof seal in lid. I can see them getting damaged or broken pretty easily. You can't put food in these. They have a really strong odor and our food smelled while camping
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Very Basic, read the review
customer_reviews.text: This thing is inexpensive, but very minimal. The plastic is thin, but very hard/durable feeling. The handles will secure the lid well, but provides no weather-proofing. It is not shock-absorbent or insulated at all. Depending on what you need it for, this should work for you. If you just need a plastic, lockable, durable tote, this is it. If you want anything more, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: Toxic, putrid, unusable piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This product smells so bad, making it completely unusable. It can't be inside a home or even in a garage or patio. The stench is so strong that I doubt it will be done out-gassing this century. Do not waste your money on this incredibly unusable product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Van Patten

customer_reviews.title: Love it for fishing gears!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome buy! I use this to go fishing or crabbing and just throw in all my nick nacks in it. I especially love how tight the lock is - I love the sound of the snap when I lock it in place, something so satisfying about that. It definitely keeps everything airtight including smells. Be sure air dry and let it breathe. Thinking of grabbing more! Needs to come in more colors.
customer_reviews.author: Trinushka

customer_reviews.title: Small but significant defect detected
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and design of the product. I generally like Plano brand equipment. However, This particular trunk was slightly damaged. One of the latches would not bite. It was loose. It was loose and could be easily removed. I found that the channels that the latch fits into had been stretched. The channel had been stretched so much that the latch drooped and wouldn’t click into place. Furthermore it looked as though the plastic had stretched so much that it was thinner at the latch joint and could break easily. The latch on the opposite side was sturdier and had not stretched. I’m returning and asking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: YBColins

customer_reviews.title: OD Green really means Dark Grey
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tote for the money! The inside of the lid can very easily accept a thin foam seal to further weatherproofing and the latches are great. My only gripe is that i specifically ordered OD green bins to match my usmc trailer and they are most definitely dark gun metal grey; they're even labeled as green. In fact, the sticker on the side of the bin shows an OD green one. So just know that green actually means dark grey when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Durdan

customer_reviews.title: Bought one of each color they have available (so 3 total) - good for the cabin.
customer_reviews.text: got these for our remote cabin in Norther Wisconsin to keep mice away from hunting gear, bedding, pillows... Not the sturdiest, but for the price - does what I want it to do. had to air out and go over with clorox wipes as it stunk of plastic bad when received. overall, good storage bins if you are not planning on moving and tossing these around much.
customer_reviews.author: KAIFS

customer_reviews.title: Lock eyelets are not the same size
customer_reviews.text: So, I needed containers that could be easily locked up. However the eyelets on the body is a little smaller than the eyelet on the lid. This size discrepency isnt a problem for most padlocks. But for me, I had to widen the eyelets to allow for the padlocks I had on hand. Asides from that one issue... concerning strength, water resistance, and carrying capacity; I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: cyeote

customer_reviews.title: Not so heavy duty but sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: I would not rate this heavy duty. One good kick would probably put a hole in the side. Im just using in for holding straps and trailer hitch kind of truck stuff. It is definitely sturdy enough for that. Easy to lock. The latch popped off the first time opening it but they pop right back in place. So farmer John buy a pelican and glamper Joe this is perfect
customer_reviews.author: trent

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable storage trunk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to keep in the covered bed of his truck. He often pulls trailers, boats, and has a "Bearing box" with necessary supplies for changing wheel bearings if he has issues on the road. This equipment is pretty heavy. This box works perfectly! It has two wheels so he can pull it without having to tote it as well. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Great storage
customer_reviews.text: I moved from a Honda Ridgeline that has a lot of storage space to a Toyota Highlander that NO storage space. I had to move at least some of my stuff over from the Ridgeline and this is working for me. Compact enough my wife doesn't object to it in the cargo area of the Highlander and almost big enough for most of my absolute essentials.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Solid water resistant box
customer_reviews.text: What you would expect for a Plano box. Fairly water tight. Doesn't have a rubber seal but there's enough inset unless it's left outside in a strong storm don't see any water getting in. Because it doesn't have a seal I wouldn't say it's water tight because I do see the potential for moisture getting in but don't see it collecting water. Very solid construction, I don't see it cracking or getting broken, it's not brittle. The tie downs are nice to have and look like they should hold up to the job. Personally the size it perfect for my needs it's my camping supplies box.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: 5 star good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price, the quality, the shipping this is a deal for the price. This tote is heavy duty. I bought it for automotive tools. This container won't break like the others. Also I wanted a removable lid which allows for a more ergonomic work area while working on vehicles. I can put my tools, jack, meters, and small parts. I am happy with this purchase and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shop

customer_reviews.title: Fairly sturdy Container
customer_reviews.text: I Ike the wheels on the container. It is pretty lightweight and sturdy but could be sturdier (if you don’t mind added weight). I used it camping for the first time and it did the job well. You unsnap 4 latches and the lid essentially falls right off...I usually had one hand busy so just would have been nice to open the container with one hand... expensive for a container but if it lasts a long time then it will be worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 on shipping, 100% recommend the item
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I was looking for to store my camping gear. The fact that it rolls is a huge life savor as well. It is worth noting that I ordered this product twice. The first time being that it arrived immediately. The second time it arrived 3 weeks late. But I rated based on the product not the sellers shipping problems.
customer_reviews.author: tabatha

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: This was on my son's list for scout camp so we ordered one. It's nice however the plastic is not as sturdy as I was expecting, especially considering the price. I also didn't like how the lid doesn't hing. If you open the latches on one side to open it the other side latched pop open. It would have been nicer if it hinged up rather then needing to remove the whole lid to open it. We will be keeping it because it's the one his scout troop wanted but I will not be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Butera

customer_reviews.title: Plano never fails
customer_reviews.text: I toss this thing all over the back of my truck, I use it to hold my tow gear and tie down straps, hasn’t had water in it at all with the rain and cold, I’ve stood on it and packed things on it and to the side of it to compress it and it doesn’t deform. I’ve always liked Plano cases and have them for a bunch of things from fun cases to just regular storage for clothing and travel and they haven’t failed me yet, and they are a fraction of the price of a pelican.
customer_reviews.author: Reynald robledo

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Storage Tote - Great for music audio cables
customer_reviews.text: This Heavy Duty Storage Tote is very nice quality and priced very reasonably. I was in need of a tote to store my audio cables when hauling music equipment in my trailer to gigs. This Tote is just what I needed. The 56 quart was perfect and with such a quality made item it should last me for years. I will buy another one if I find I need more storage.
customer_reviews.author: GraceHeart Sound

customer_reviews.title: Great storage and durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent, I have 7 in various sizes and they are stackable. They are built tough and makes storing items easier. I use the smaller size for gun ammo etc, the larger I store my tools etc. I also bought zipper type assorted reinforced storage bags and that way I can seperate car parts, pins, screws, etc. Makes it easy to store and find next time.
customer_reviews.author: rotwiler

customer_reviews.title: Wasted space
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a great box, but the lid waste 1 inch of space for no apparent reason. So, if you packing isn't flush with the box then you won't be able to close the lid. The items I was packing cannot bend, so the wasted space prevented me from closing the box. Also, Amazon will charge you $6 to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love this container
customer_reviews.text: We got 2 of these for camping. We were specifically looking for containers that weren't too big or bulky but you could sit on them. Couldn't find anything that worked at Walmart. This container fits the bill perfectly. We are each around 180 lbs and we can sit on this container with no problems. I wouldn't recommend bouncing or heavily plopping down on it but to sit and put on a pair of shoes is absolutely no problem. They also stack on each other very securely.
customer_reviews.author: Laura F

customer_reviews.title: Rigid box you can sit on.
customer_reviews.text: Color is slightly off on mine other than that great box. I'm 200lbs and I would/will and have sit on this box empty. I wouldn't and don't let people sit on my 1819 empty the 1619 & 1719 are more rigid than the old models. No hinge is great now I don't have to worry about the hinge bending or poping off. Great seal to very confident it's water resistant and could easily be made water proof with ducttape.
customer_reviews.author: Haahtag_butt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my moto gear
customer_reviews.text: I can fit a pair of men's size 13 Alpinestar boots, a L/XL Fox Titan jacket, knee braces, socks, a jersey, moto pants, and more in this thing. The lid is secure in the back of the truck on the highway and it seems to keep the rain out. Overall it does exactly what I wanted it to do and was a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for camping supplies. These are suppose to be 68 qt which is 17 gallon. I have 2 half gal in it in photo in it. Plus a photo of it beside 1 of my smallest containers. Very disappointed. And useless for my purpose. Sent both back. I just can't see where they are 68 qt. It seems sturdy. Latches seem ok. Size NO.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Not good for college.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have a proper handle and can’t be locked with padlock. One side you’d think would have a hinge, but no, it opens on both sides and the lock holes aren’t large enough for padlock. Having to lock both sides makes this product less easy to use. NOT a Lois storage locker for college students.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Herman

customer_reviews.title: Would maybe be better with hinges
customer_reviews.text: The crate is pretty decent and sturdy, but there's latches on both the front and back of the lid. I expected hinges at the back of the lid and locking tabs on the front, but it's latches on both sides and the lid lifts entirely off the crate rather than staying attached when you open it.
customer_reviews.author: julio

customer_reviews.title: Great for water resistant travel
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to put our small suitcases cases in during a cross country trip in the back of our trucks. While we drove, it poured the rain for a good long while and nothing inside got wet. They roll nicely and stack easily enough. If you have a carry on sized suitcase it should fit width and height wise (did for ours at least), plus some space on the ends for extra items.
customer_reviews.author: LAnne

customer_reviews.title: Good for SUV Storage Concealment
customer_reviews.text: We are photographers and I purchased this for the storage area of our Subaru Forester. It fits in the vehicle perfectly and is black in color so it can barely be seen through the tinted back windows. It is large enough to store tripods, cameras, coats, etc. and it sure beats blocking the view of valuable items with a coat draped over the items. Out of sight and out of mind when it comes to vehicle security. For our needs that works perfectly and I am glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's durable, has pretty good capacity and is water and dust resistant. If you want even more water and dust resistance, get a pack of this, separate the seals and stick them into the lid gutter. The pack has enough material for two lids:
customer_reviews.author: Scott McCrory

product_meta.title: Plano Storage Trunk - 108 Quart w/Wheels (1919) - Black
